etymology.description: semantic: 力 ‘strength/plowing’ + 口 ‘mouth’ (exclamation/breath) — to put more effort; exaggerate.
etymology.interpretation: Combining strength/power (力) with the mouth (口) evokes the exertion and breath/sound made when putting in extra effort. This association broadened to the idea of increasing or adding, which extends to the arithmetic sense of “plus.”

examples.chinese: 二加三等于五(二加三等於五)。
请给我加一点儿糖(請給我加一點兒糖)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng gěi wǒ jiā yīdiǎnr táng.
examples.english: Please add a little sugar for me.
